ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
1. Anthony and Beth take turns using the computer to ensure that each gets equal time
2. Anthony makes the decisions and Beth follows them
3. When asked for a donation by a Salvation Army Worker, Anthony and Beth decided they should both give $10
1. Alan keeps track of the time he spends with Patty relative to the time he spends with other people
2. Patty brings home all the money she earns and turns it over to Alan; whenever she needs spending money, she asks Alan and he gives her some
3. Alan and Patty feel like they've always been together, and always will be
4. Karen is careful not to interrupt Jerry when he is speaking, but he interrupts her sometimes
5. Jerry and Karen had to make an important decision
6. Jerry won an award earlier this year. Karen figured that Jerry had earned it and that Jerry's tremendous investment of time and energy had finally paid off.
7. Betty bought Ted a cake for his birthday only because she remembered that he had bought her a cake on her birthday.
8. When eating at a restaurant, Ted and Betty often share their food or drinks.
9. Ted and Betty recently flipped a coin to decide which one of them would choose the movie they would see.
10. When asked for a donation by a Salvation Army worker, Mark and Kelly decided they should both give $10.

12. Kelly is always thinking about how much time she should spend with Mark and whether being with Mark is a good use of her time
